newsitem.title: FINLAND: Kesko sees 4 pct 1997 sales growth.
newsitem.headline: Kesko sees 4 pct 1997 sales growth.

text.p: Finnish wholesaler and retailer Kesko Oy said on Thursday it expected sales to increase around four percent this year and that its aim was to retain good profitability.
"Our sales are expected to increase by about four percent in 1997, and the aim is to retain a good profit level," Kesko said in a statement with its 1996 results.
Kesko reported a 740 million markka profit before extraordinaries and tax compared to 689 million in 1995.
Net sales increased by 11 percent to 29.3 billion markka.
Kesko said it was -- even without Tuko's daily goods operations -- a big company for Finland and that it would look for growth overseas.
"We are looking towards Russia and the Baltics," CEO Eero Kinnunen said, but did not give any details.
Kesko also said it would continue to expand its hardware and shoe retailing operations in Sweden. @
Kesko said the acquisition of trading house Kaukomarkkinat last spring was supporting its overseas expansion.
